noPurposesLabel: This client is not associated with any purpose
noKeysLabel: This client does not contain public keys
purposeFailureMessage: Warning! It will not be possible to obtain a voucher for this purpose. Service has been suspended in one or more components of the pipeline. The suspended components are:
title: Simulate voucher acquisition
description: Through this feature, you can simulate obtaining a voucher. Once the parameters are selected, you can perform a client assertion, request a voucher, and check that it is compatible.

step1.description: Used to show you the correct parameters to populate the client assertion

keySelectInput.label: Choose the public key to use

currentIdsDrawer.title: View current selection IDs
currentIdsDrawer.subtitle: Useful parameters to obtain information through PDND APIs. Have questions? <1>Check the guide</1>.
currentIdsDrawer.eserviceIdDescription: The ID of the e-service linked to the selected purpose
currentIdsDrawer.descriptorIdDescription: The ID of the e-service version linked to the selected purpose
currentIdsDrawer.agreementIdDescription: The ID of the service request linked to the selected purpose
currentIdsDrawer.purposeIdDescription: The ID of the selected purpose

producerOrganizationId.label: organizationId (producer)
producerOrganizationId.description: The ID of the producing party

description.label: The first step is to create an assertion signed by your party with the private key corresponding to one of the public keys you have uploaded to this client. Below are the details to create the JWS according to the specification

kidField.label: KID
kidField.description: The ID of the key selected in the previous step

algField.label: ALG
algField.description: The algorithm used to sign this JWT. At this time, signing is only possible with RS256

typField.label: TYP
typField.description: The type of object being sent, in this case “JWT”

issField.label: ISS
issField.description: The issuer of the request; in this case, the ID of this client

subField.label: SUB
subField.description: The subject of the request; in this case, always the client ID

audField.label: AUD
audField.description: The target audience; in this case, a PDND resource

purposeIdField.label: PurposeId
purposeIdField.description: The ID of the purpose selected in the previous step

jtiField.label: JTI
jtiField.description: A unique random (UUID) ID generated by the token creator. Used to identify the token itself
jtiField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 261cd445-3da6-421b-9ef4-7ba556efda5f

iatField.label: IAT
iatField.description: Issued at: the timestamp indicating the date and time when the token is created, expressed in UNIX epoch (numeric value, not string)
iatField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 1651659340

expField.label: EXP
expField.description: Expiration: the timestamp indicating the token expiration date and time, expressed in UNIX epoch (numeric value, not string)
expField.suggestionLabel: You must generate this parameter yourself. Example value: 1651738540

assertionScript.title: Example for generating a client assertion

steps.1: Create a folder and name it “client_assertion_test”
steps.2: Place the script <1>{{ filename }}</1> in the folder (Python 3.8 required)
steps.3: Create a “keys” folder and place the private key inside, naming it “client-test-keypair.rsa.priv”
steps.4: Open the terminal and navigate to the client_assertion_test folder
steps.5: Paste the command below and press enter
steps.result: This will generate a client assertion signed with your private key. Warning: the private key must match the public key you selected in the previous step.

step3.title: Voucher request
step3.consumerDescription: Once the JWS has been signed with your private key, it must be used to make a voucher request to the PDND authorization server. If successful, a voucher usable at the producer’s e-service will be returned
step3.apiDescription: Once the JWS has been signed with your private key, it must be used to make a voucher request to the PDND authorization server. If successful, a voucher usable at the PDND API gateway will be returned

clientAssertionField.label: client_assertion
clientAssertionField.suggestionLabel: The JWS obtained from the previous step (starts with “ey”)

clientAssertionTypeField.label: client_assertion_type
clientAssertionTypeField.description: The target audience; in this case, a PDND resource

voucherScript.title: Example cURL
voucherScript.guide: Open the terminal, replace the placeholder YOUR_CLIENT_ASSERTION with the assertion you obtained in the previous step, and run the cURL. If you don’t have cURL, <1>you can install it</1> via Brew.

debugVoucherAlert.description: Unable to obtain a valid voucher? Try the

CONSUMER.title: Congratulations!
CONSUMER.description: You can now access the API of the e-service {{ eserviceName }} produced by {{ producerName }}
CONSUMER.actionDescription: You can access the data made available by the producer

API.title: Congratulations!
API.description: You can now access the PDND APIs
API.actionDescription: The API that allows parties to interact with PDND in machine-to-machine mode

apiV1.title: API v.1 (deprecated)
apiV1.description: The API version currently in use and being deprecated.

apiV2.title: API v.2 (recommended)
apiV2.description: The most recent API version as the new standard for machine-to-machine communications to Interoperability.

pushApiSH.title: Signal submission (Push API)
pushApiSH.description: The API that allows producers to send data change signals

pullApiSH.title: Signal retrieval (Pull API)
pullApiSH.description: The API that allows consumers to retrieve data change signals

edit.title: Request data to the server
edit.description: The request will be sent to the authorization server endpoint: {{ authServer }}

description.apiSuccess: This request is valid; it is possible to obtain a voucher for the PDND APIs
description.consumerSuccess: This request is valid; it is possible to obtain a voucher for the e-service <1>{{eserviceName}}, {{eserviceVersion}}</1>
description.failed: It is not possible to obtain a voucher for this request

label.publicKeyRetrieve: 2. Retrieval of the public key stored on PDND
label.clientAssertionSignatureVerification: 3. Verification of the client assertion signature
label.platformStatesVerification: 4. Verification of the component states on PDND

requestSection.title: Content of your request
requestSection.description: Below is the body (payload) of the request that was sent to the PDND authorization server

clientAssertionType.label: Client_assertion_type
clientAssertionType.description: The format of the client assertion, as specified in RFC

grantType.label: Grant_type
grantType.description: The type of flow used, as specified in RFC

title.publicKeyRetrieve: 2. Retrieval of the public key stored on PDND
title.clientAssertionSignatureVerification: 3. Verification of the client assertion signature
title.platformStatesVerification: 4. Verification of the component states on PDND

description.clientAssertionValidation: It is verified that the client assertion is well structured. All required fields must be present and correctly filled.
description.publicKeyRetrieve: It is verified that the public key corresponding to the kid in the client assertion is present on PDND and can be retrieved.
description.clientAssertionSignatureVerification: It is verified that the private key used to sign the client assertion matches the public key identified by the kid and retrieved in step 2.
description.platformStatesVerification: It is verified that all administrative and technical components required by PDND are active

errors.8001: The string entered as client_id is not a UUID. You can find the correct value in your client page
errors.8002: The string entered as grant_type is incorrect. It must be client_credentials
errors.8003: The string entered as client_assertion_type is incorrect. It must be urn:ietf:params:oauth:client-assertion-type:jwt-bearer
errors.8006: The SUB (subject) claim of the client assertion is not a valid UUID. The subject value is the client ID, which you can find in your client page
errors.8007: The SUB (subject) claim is missing from the client assertion. The subject value is the client ID, which you can find in your client page
errors.8008: The SUB (subject) claim in the client assertion does not match the client_id entered in the call to the authorization server
errors.8009: The string entered as purposeId is not a UUID. You can find the correct value in your client page by selecting the desired purpose
errors.8010: The AUD (audience) claim does not contain the correct audience
errors.8011: The hash entered in the value field in the digest does not have the expected length for the SHA256 hashing algorithm
errors.8012: The hashing of the value field in the digest must be performed using SHA256
errors.8013: The KID field is missing from the client assertion header
errors.8014: The ALG field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8015: The JTI field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8016: The IAT field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8017: The ISS field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8018: The EXP field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8019: The digest field in the client assertion payload must contain two fields: alg and value
errors.8020: The digest field in the client assertion payload must contain two fields: alg and value
errors.8023: The signature of the client assertion is not valid. Make sure that the private key you used to sign the assertion matches the public key stored on PDND whose kid you indicated
errors.8024: The purposeId field is missing from the client assertion payload
errors.8025: The ID of the purpose you indicated (purposeId) does not match any purpose associated with the client ID you indicated
errors.8026: The client assertion is valid but the purpose for which you are requesting the voucher is not active
errors.8027: The client assertion is valid but the version of the e-service for which you are requesting the voucher is not active
errors.8028: The client assertion is valid but the service request for which you are requesting the voucher is not active
errors.8033: The kid field is not correctly filled. The kid can only contain alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores. The one sent contains unrecognized special characters
errors.8099: The key ID you indicated (kid) is not part of the client you indicated as client ID
